body_html:
So is it a separate repo now?

If there is a push towards abstraction and modularization, shouldn't other folders become separate entities?

For example

  • Tensorboard could be a submodule, because although it is related, it more of a tool FOR TF rather than an integral part of it
  • Examples this is also not necessary for correct operation of TF, and could be moved out (same as models).
  • Contrib could be a separate project with its own documentation (aka SciKit)

Any ideas on which direction it is headed?
body_text:
So is it a separate repo now?
If there is a push towards abstraction and modularization, shouldn't other folders become separate entities?
For example

Tensorboard could be a submodule, because although it is related, it more of a tool FOR TF rather than an integral part of it
Examples this is also not necessary for correct operation of TF, and could be moved out (same as models).
Contrib could be a separate project with its own documentation (aka SciKit)

Any ideas on which direction it is headed?
body:
So is it a separate repo now?

If there is a push towards abstraction and modularization, shouldn't other folders become separate entities? 

For example
 - [Tensorboard](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/2e22f1b20fdfa77b1332c518617391dc32359c5b/tensorflow/tensorboard) could be a submodule, because although it is related, it more of a tool FOR TF rather than an integral part of it
- [Examples](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/2e22f1b20fdfa77b1332c518617391dc32359c5b/tensorflow/examples) this is also not necessary for correct operation of TF, and could be moved out (same as `models`).
- [Contrib](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/2e22f1b20fdfa77b1332c518617391dc32359c5b/tensorflow/contrib) could be a separate project with its own documentation (aka SciKit)

Any ideas on which direction it is headed?
